intro: Sphenosciadium capitellatum, commonly known as the small-headed sphenosciadium, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, a feature common in the Apiaceae family. The leaves are usually pinnately lobed, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens.
